p: Green tea ( Camellia sinensis L.) is known for its high content of polyphenols, especially catechins and for its strong antioxidant activity, having many benefits for human health [ 18]. Rather recently, researchers have begun to investigate the antimicrobial potential of green tea extracts. It appears that catechins found in green tea present a variety of antimicrobial properties, especially against most oral bacteria [ 19, 20].
